messageBody:
Hi David,

On 12/22/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> > As you already know, I think it would be nice if JUnit at least gave us
> the
> > option.
>
> Well, it does, especially in JUnit 4, which has an extensible Runner
> framework. The below test class has two inner classes.
> RunWithOneInstance is a test class which will only be run once, and
> OneInstance is the custom Runner that makes it possible.


Right, but it forces you to introduce a static in your code, so it's not
really an improvement over JUnit3 in this respect. As you know, statics can
have some nasty side effects (not same-JVM-friendly, require synchronization
in multiple thread environments) but worst of all, among all the possible
types of shareable states, statics are the worst since they can cause state
to leak between entire suite runs.

Sharing expensive immutable state in the same test class is a totally
harmless and extremely common scenario that I wish JUnit made easier to
implement (i.e. no statics and no special runner).

--
Cédric
